page.title: 14JUBILEE HOUSE, WOODPERRY
page.content: Jubilee House was built for the Girl Guides of Oxfordshire and was opened in 1975. Cub Scouts, Scouts and the local Brownie Guide Unit meet in it. It is also used for Guider Committee meetings, training sessions and conferences. In holiday time and weekends Brownies use the house and grounds for Pack Holidays and Guides camp in its surroundings. The house is a single storied building. It has a main hall with dormitories, a kitchen and toilets. There is also a store for camp equipment in the grounds. Jubilee House is situated at Woodperry on the road from the White House to Horton-cum- Studley.
